items.name: IORETENR
items.description: port Standby IO retention enable register

items.name: IORETR
items.description: port Standby IO retention status register

items.name: RADIOSCR
items.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO status and control register

fields.name: LPMS
fields.description: Low-power mode selection These bits select the low-power mode entered when the CPU enters the SleepDeep mode. 10x: Standby mode others reserved

fields.name: R2RSB1
fields.description: SRAM2 retention in Standby mode This bit is used to keep the SRAM2 content in Standby retention mode.

fields.name: ULPMEN
fields.description: BOR0 ultra-low-power mode.  This bit is used to reduce the consumption by configuring the BOR0 in discontinuous mode for Stop 1 and Standby modes. Discontinuous mode is only available when BOR levels 1 to 4 and PVD are disabled. Note: This bit must be set to reach the lowest power consumption in the low-power modes. Note: This bit must not be set together with autonomous peripherals using HSI as kernel clock. Note: When BOR level 1 to 4 or PVD is enabled continuous mode applies independent from ULPMEN.

fields.name: RADIORSB
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO SRAMs (RXTXRAM and Sequence RAM) and Sleep clock retention in Standby mode. This bit is used to keep the 2.4 GHz RADIO SRAMs content in Standby retention mode and the 2.4 GHz RADIO sleep timer counter operational.

fields.name: R1RSB567
fields.description: SRAM1 192 KB page 5 to 7 retention in Standby mode Used to keep SRAM1 page 5 to 7 content in Standby retention mode.

fields.name: R1RSB
fields.description: SRAM1 page X retention in Standby mode This bit is used to keep the SRAM1 content in Standby retention mode.

fields.name: SRAM1PDS
fields.description: SRAM1 page X power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1) Note: The SRAM1 retention in Standby mode is controlled by R1RSBX bit in CR1.

fields.name: SRAM2PDS1
fields.description: SRAM2 power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1) Note: The SRAM2 retention in Standby mode is controlled by R2RSB1 bit in CR1.

fields.name: SRAM1PDS567
fields.description: SRAM1 192KB, page 5 to 7 power-down in Stop modes

fields.name: ICRAMPDS
fields.description: ICACHE SRAM power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1)

fields.name: PRAMPDS
fields.description: OTG SRAM power-down in Stop modes.

fields.name: PKARAMPDS
fields.description: PKA SRAM power-down in Stop modes.

fields.name: FLASHFWU
fields.description: Flash memory fast wakeup from Stop modes (Stop 0, 1) This bit is used to obtain the best trade-off between low-power consumption and wakeup time when exiting the Stop 0 or Stop 1 modes. When this bit is set, the Flash memory remains in normal mode in Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes, which offers a faster startup time with higher consumption.

fields.name: REGSEL
fields.description: Regulator selection.

fields.name: FSTEN
fields.description: Fast soft start

fields.name: DIVCLP
fields.description: Low power mode regulator clock division.

fields.name: SELREP
fields.description: Low power mode regulator replica selection.

fields.name: V11FBSW
fields.description: V11 feedback switch enable (non user bit).

fields.name: DBP
fields.description: Disable Backup domain write protection In reset state, all registers and SRAM in Backup domain are protected against parasitic write access. This bit must be set to enable the write access to these registers.

fieldset/IORETENR.description: port A Standby IO retention enable register

fields.name: EN
fields.description: Port A Standby GPIO retention enable Access can be protected by GPIOA SECy, privilege protection is controlled by SPRIV or NSPRIV. When set, each bit enables the Standby GPIO retention feature for PAy

fieldset/IORETR.description: port A Standby IO retention status register

fields.name: RET
fields.description: Port A Standby GPIO retention active Access can be protected by GPIOA SECy, privilege protection is controlled by SPRIV or NSPRIV.

fields.name: SPRIV
fields.description: secure functions privilege configuration This bit is set and reset by software. It can be written only by a secure privileged access.

fields.name: NSPRIV
fields.description: non-secure functions privilege configuration This bit is set and reset by software. It can be written only by privileged access, secure or non-secure.

fields.name: MODE
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO operating mode. 1x: 2.4 GHz RADIO active mode

fields.name: PHYMODE
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO PHY operating mode

fields.name: ENCMODE
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO encryption function operating mode

fields.name: RFVDDHPA
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO VDDHPA control word. Bits [3:0] see Table 81: PA output power table format for definition. Bit [4] rf_event.

fields.name: REGPARDYV11
fields.description: Ready bit for Vless thansub DDHPAless than/sub voltage level when selecting VDD11 input.

fields.name: REGPARDYVDDRFPA
fields.description: Ready bit for V<sub>DDHPA</sub> voltage level when selecting VDDRFPA input. Note: REGPARDYVDDRFPA does not allow to detect correct V<sub>DDHPA</sub> voltage level when request to lower the level.

fields.name: REGPASEL
fields.description: regulator REG_VDDHPA input supply selection.

fields.name: REGPABYPEN
fields.description: regulator REG_VDDHPA bypass enable.

fields.name: PTASREN
fields.description: PTA output signals Stop 2 mode retention enable Access can be secured by GTZC_TZSC PTACONVSEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: PTASR
fields.description: PTA interface output signals state retention in Stop 2 mode active Access can be secured by GTZC_TZSC PTACONVSEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUP1SEC
fields.description: WUP1 secure protection

fields.name: LPMSEC
fields.description: Low-power modes secure protection

fields.name: VDMSEC
fields.description: Voltage detection secure protection

fields.name: VBSEC
fields.description: Backup domain secure protection

fields.name: CSSF
fields.description: Clear Stop and Standby flags Access can be secured by LPMSEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV. Writing 1 to this bit clears the STOPF and SBF flags.

fields.name: STOPF
fields.description: Stop flag This bit is set by hardware when the device enters a Stop or Standby mode at the same time as the sysclk has been set by hardware to select HSI. It’s cleared by software by writing 1 to the CSSF bit and by hardware when SBF is set.

fields.name: SBF
fields.description: Standby flag This bit is set by hardware when the device enters the Standby mode and the CPU restart from its reset vector. It’s cleared by writing 1 to the CSSF bit, or by a power-on reset. It is not cleared by the system reset.

fields.name: STOP2F
fields.description: Stop 2 mode peripherals power down flag.

fields.name: PVDE
fields.description: Programmable voltage detector enable

fields.name: PVDLS
fields.description: Programmable voltage detector level selection These bits select the voltage threshold detected by the programmable voltage detector:

fields.name: USV
fields.description: VDDUSB supply valid.

fields.name: IO2SV
fields.description: VDDIO2 supply valid.

fields.name: REGS
fields.description: Regulator selection.

fields.name: PVDO
fields.description: Programmable voltage detector output

fields.name: ACTVOSRDY
fields.description: Voltage level ready for currently used VOS

fields.name: ACTVOS
fields.description: VOS currently applied to V<sub>CORE</sub> This field provides the last VOS value.

fields.name: VDD11USBRDY
fields.description: USB OTG VDD11USB ready.

fields.name: USBBOOSTRDY
fields.description: USB OTG booster ready.

fields.name: VOSRDY
fields.description: Ready bit for V<sub>CORE</sub> voltage scaling output selection Set and cleared by hardware. When decreasing the voltage scaling range, VOSRDY must be one before increasing the SYSCLK frequency.

fields.name: VOS
fields.description: Voltage scaling range selection Set a and cleared by software. Cleared by hardware when entering Stop 1 mode. Access can be secured by RCC SYSCLKSEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: USBPWREN
fields.description: USB OTG power enable.

fields.name: USBBOOSTEN
fields.description: USB OTG booster enable.

fields.name: VDD11USBDIS
fields.description: USB OTG VDD11USB disable.

fields.name: VDD11USBSWDLY
fields.description: USB OTG VDD11USB switch delay.

fields.name: WUPEN
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP1 enable Access can be secured by WUP1SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUPP
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP1 polarity. This bit must be configured when WUPEN1 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP1SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUSEL
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUPX selection This field must be configured when WUPENX = 0. Access can be secured by WUPXSEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: CWUF
fields.description: Clear wakeup flag 1 Access can be secured by WUP1SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV. Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF1 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: WUF
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pending flag 1 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP1 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF1 bit of WUSCR or by hardware when WUPEN1 = 0.

variants.name: Range2
variants.description: Range 2 (lowest power)

variants.name: Range1
variants.description: Range 1 (highest frequency)

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: VsubCORE/sub is above or below the current voltage scaling provided by ACTVOS.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: VsubCORE /subis equal to the current voltage scaling provided by ACTVOS.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Low power regulator clock not divided.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO encryption function disabled.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO encryption function enabled.

variants.name: LowPower
variants.description: Flash memory enters low-power mode in Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes (lower-power consumption).

variants.name: Normal
variants.description: Flash memory remains in normal mode in Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes (faster wakeup time).

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: LDO fast startup disabled (limited inrush current).

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: LDO fast startup enabled.

variants.name: Retained
variants.description: ICACHE SRAM content retained in Stop modes

variants.name: NotRetained
variants.description: ICACHE SRAM content lost in Stop modes

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: VDDIO2 not supplied, electrical and logical isolation enabled.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: VDDIO2 supply present, electrical and logical isolation disabled.

variants.name: Stop0
variants.description: Stop 0 mode

variants.name: Stop1
variants.description: Stop 1 mode

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: CR1, CR2 and CSSF in the SR can be read and written with secure or non-secure access.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: CR1, CR2, and CSSF in the SR can be read and written only with secure access.

variants.name: DeepSleep
variants.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO deep sleep mode

variants.name: Sleep
variants.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO sleep mode

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO Sleep mode.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO Standby mode.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: PKA SRAM content retained in Stop modes.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: PKA SRAM content lost in Stop modes.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: OTG SRAM content retained in Stop modes.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: OTG SRAM content lost in Stop modes.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Cleared by software, writing 0.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Set by hardware when Stop 2 mode PTA retention is enabled in PTASREN and Stop 2 mode is entered.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: PTA output signals Stop 2 retention feature disabled.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: PTA output signals Stop 2 retention feature enabled.

variants.name: v20
variants.description: VPVD0 around 2.0 V

variants.name: v22
variants.description: VPVD1 around 2.2 V

variants.name: v24
variants.description: VPVD2 around 2.4 V

variants.name: v25
variants.description: VPVD3 around 2.5 V

variants.name: v26
variants.description: VPVD4 around 2.6 V

variants.name: v28
variants.description: VPVD5 around 2.8 V

variants.name: v29
variants.description: VPVD6 around 2.9 V

variants.name: pvd_in
variants.description: External input analog voltage PVD_IN (compared internally to VREFINT)

variants.name: AboveOrEqual
variants.description: VDD is equal or above the PVD threshold selected by PVDLS[2:0].

variants.name: Below
variants.description: VDD is below the PVD threshold selected by PVDLS[2:0].

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: VDDRFPA pin selected as regulator REG_VDDHPA input supply.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: regulator REG_VDDHPA input supply selection between VDDRFPA and VDD11, dependent on requested regulated output voltage.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: LDO selected.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: SMPS selected.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: LDO selected.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: SMPS selected.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: The device did not enter Standby mode.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: The device entered Standby mode.

variants.name: PoweredOn
variants.description: SRAM1 192KB, page 5 to 7 content retained in Stop modes

variants.name: PoweredOff
variants.description: SRAM1 192KB, page 5 to 7 content lost in Stop modes

variants.name: PoweredOn
variants.description: SRAM1 content retained in Stop modes

variants.name: PoweredOff
variants.description: SRAM1 content lost in Stop modes

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: VDDUSB not supplied, electrical and logical isolation enabled.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: VDDUSB supply present, electrical and logical isolation disabled.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: V11 feedback fixed before Epod.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: V11 feedback switch enabled:.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: DBPCR can be read and written with secure or non-secure access.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: DBPCR can be read and written only with secure access.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: SVMCR and CR3 can be read and written with secure or non-secure access.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: SVMCR and CR3 can be read and written only with secure access.

variants.name: Range2
variants.description: Range 2 (lowest power)

variants.name: Range1
variants.description: Range 1 (highest frequency).

variants.description: Detection on high level (rising edge)

variants.name: Low
variants.description: Detection on low level (falling edge)

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: reserved

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: WKUP3_1

variants.name: B_0x2
variants.description: WKUP3_2
